info.title: Text Request
info.description: Text Request is a business texting platform that helps businesses turn conversations into customers.

get.summary: Get a conversation's messages by a contact's phone number
get.description: Retrieves the conversation between the specified dashboard and phone number.

parameters.name: page
parameters.x-ms-summary: Number page to get
parameters.description: The page of entities to get. When getting values, there is a max size per page, defined by page_size. If page is greater than the last page, an empty array will be returned.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.x-ms-summary: Amount of each entity to get per page
parameters.description: The size of each page to get. When getting values, this is a max size per page, with accessing subsequent pages done by the page parameter.

parameters.name: dashboard_id
parameters.x-ms-summary: Id of the dashboard to make this call on
parameters.description: The phone number dashboard to work on. A single account can have several dashboards, representing different phone lines for customers.

parameters.name: phone_number
parameters.x-ms-summary: Contact's phone number to search by
parameters.description: Phone number of the contact to get messages for.

200.description: The return payload when the request succeeds without any errors.

page.description: The page of entities gotten. The amount of entities in this page is defined by page_size.

page_size.description: The number of entities gotten in this page.

total_items.description: The number of entities available in the database, regardless of the page size or number. To see the other pages, change the page number in the request.

meta.description: Metadata about the data returned by this request. This data is returned by all bulk GET requests.

message_id.description: Id of the message. This value is unique for each message.

message_direction.description: Singular character, either R or S, denoting whether this message was received from the contact or sent to them, respectively.

response_by_username.description: Username of the Text Request user that last sent a message to this user.

message_timestamp_utc.description: Timestamp of when the message was sent or received by Text Request.

delivery_status.description: Current status of this message. This can be 'sending', 'delivered', 'error', or 'send'.

delivery_error.description: Error that caused this message to not be delivered. If the delivery_status is not 'error', this value will be null.

mms_media.description: List of urls pointing to this message's attachments. All urls will be text-request generated urls.

items.description: List of message entities gotten from Text Request.

204.description: The return payload when the request succeeds, but found no content to return.

post.summary: Send a message to the contact with the given phone number
post.description: Sends a message (starting a new conversation if the given phone number has no message history).

parameters.name: dashboard_id
parameters.description: The phone number dashboard to work on. A single account can have several dashboards, representing different phone lines for customers.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Id of the dashboard to make this call on

parameters.name: phone_number
parameters.description: Phone number of the contact to send a message to.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Phone Number to Message

body.description: Content of the message to send.

sender_name.description: The name of the message sender. This is shown in the TextRequest web app and api when retrieving this message.

status_callback.description: Url for the web app to hit with a POST command whenever this message's status goes from undelivered to sent (or error).
status_callback.x-ms-summary: Callback url for when the message status updates

location_callback.description: Location callback url to hit with a POST command when the user accesses and approves sharing their location with the sender. To include the link, add [Location Request] to the message body. This callback is not required for location requests, but it can be useful for APIs.
location_callback.x-ms-summary: Callback url for location requests if this message includes one

mms_media.description: Array of MMS Media attachments for this message. Attachments must be urls gotten from the post /mms endpoint (not included in this connector). External attachment links will not be accepted.
mms_media.x-ms-summary: MMS Media attachments for this message

200.description: The return payload when the request succeeds without any errors.

message_id.description: Id of the message. This value is unique for each message.

message_direction.description: Singular character, either R or S, denoting whether this message was received from the contact or sent to them, respectively.

response_by_username.description: Username of the Text Request user that last sent a message to this user.

message_timestamp_utc.description: Timestamp of when the message was sent or received by Text Request.

delivery_status.description: Current status of this message. This can be 'sending', 'delivered', 'error', or 'send'.

delivery_error.description: Error that caused this message to not be delivered. If the delivery_status is not 'error', this value will be null.

mms_media.description: List of urls pointing to this message's attachments. All urls will be text-request generated urls.

400.description: The return payload when the request has bad, missing, or invalid data.

put.description: Archiving a conversation removes it from the results of all conversation retrieval endpoints. A conversation will be automatically unarchived if the customer sends a text to your Text Request number, or if you send the customer a text from your Text Request number. Archiving conversations is a good way to remove clutter from customers you donâ€™t plan on talking to in the future. Note that if a customer texts in "STOP" to prevent you from sending them any further SMS messages, the conversation is automatically archived.

parameters.name: dashboard_id
parameters.description: The phone number dashboard to work on. A single account can have several dashboards, representing different phone lines for customers.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Id of the dashboard to make this call on

parameters.name: phone_number
parameters.description: Phone number of the conversation to archive.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Phone Number of conversation

200.description: The return payload when the request succeeds without any errors.

put.description: Unarchive a conversation. Once a conversation is unarchived, it will once again appear in the queue. it will also appear in conversations returned by the /conversations endpoint. If a conversation is already unarchived, this method has no effect.

parameters.name: dashboard_id
parameters.description: The phone number dashboard to work on. A single account can have several dashboards, representing different phone lines for customers.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Id of the dashboard to make this call on

parameters.name: phone_number
parameters.description: Phone number of the conversation to archive.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Phone Number of conversation

200.description: The return payload when the request succeeds without any errors.

get.summary: Retrieves the contact with the specified phone number
get.description: If a contact does not yet exist with this phone number in this dashboard, no content will be returned, and no error will be thrown. Only the dashboard specified will be searched; contacts are organized by dashboard, and there is no account level search for a number available.

parameters.name: dashboard_id
parameters.description: The phone number dashboard to work on. A single account can have several dashboards, representing different phone lines for customers.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Id of the dashboard to make this call on

parameters.name: phone_number
parameters.description: Phone number of the contact to get.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Phone Number of the contact

200.description: The return payload when the request succeeds without any errors.

display_name.description: Full name of this contact. This is the default name displayed in the web app when viewing contacts.

is_suppressed.description: Whether the conversation with this contact are suppressed, and therefore not pushed to the top of the message queue when received.

is_archived.description: Whether the conversation with this contact are archived, and therefore cannot be seen when querying conversations (by default).

is_blocked.description: Whether the conversation with this contact are blocked, and therefore not received or stored.

suppressed_reason.description: Phrase describing the reason for suppressing contact. If is_suppressed is false, this will be null.

note.description: Short phrase describing contact. Used for convenience. This is never shown to the contact.

groups.description: Array of integer ids referring to groups this contact belongs to.

contact_tags.description: Array of guids referring to tags attached to this contact.

id.description: Guid referring to a custom field.

value.description: This contact's value for this custom field.

custom_fields.description: Array of custom field ids and values defined for this contact.

is_resolved.description: Whether the conversation with this contact is resolved. Any new texts received by this contact will set this false.

first_contact_utc.description: Timestamp of when the first message was sent to this contact.

opted_out_utc.description: Timestamp of when this contact opted out to receiving messages.

last_msg_sent_utc.description: Timestamp of when the last message was sent to this contact.

last_msg_received_utc.description: Timestamp of when the last message was received from this contact.

total_msgs_sent.description: The number of total messages sent to this contact.

total_msgs_received.description: The number of total messages received from this contact.

response_count.description: The total number of response messages from the contact.

date_created_utc.description: The timestamp of when ths contact was created.

last_contact_date_utc.description: The timestamp of when the last message was sent or received from this contact.

message_id.description: Id of the message. This value is unique for each message.

message_direction.description: Singular character, either R or S, denoting whether this message was received from the contact or sent to them, respectively.

response_by_username.description: Username of the Text Request user that last sent a message to this user.

message_timestamp_utc.description: Timestamp of when the message was sent or received by Text Request.

delivery_status.description: Current status of this message. This can be 'sending', 'delivered', 'error', or 'send'.

delivery_error.description: Error that caused this message to not be delivered. If the delivery_status is not 'error', this value will be null.

mms_media.description: List of urls pointing to this message's attachments. All urls will be text-request generated urls.

last_message.description: Last message sent to or from this contact.

204.description: The return payload when the request succeeds, but found no content to return.

delete.summary: Deletes the contact with the specified phone number
delete.description: If a contact does not exist with this phone number in this dashboard, no content will be returned. If a contact does exist, but has no message history, no content will be returned, and a successful status code will indicate it was deleted. If a contact has any message history, it cannot be deleted, then a Bad Request error will be returned.

parameters.name: dashboard_id
parameters.description: The phone number dashboard to work on. A single account can have several dashboards, representing different phone lines for customers.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Id of the dashboard to make this call on

parameters.name: phone_number
parameters.description: Phone number of the contact to delete.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Phone Number of contact

200.description: The return payload when the request succeeds without any errors.

400.description: The return payload when the request has bad, missing, or invalid data.

404.description: The return payload when the requested entity could not be found.

post.description: Creates or updates a contact (depending on whether one already exists with the given phone number).

parameters.name: dashboard_id
parameters.description: The phone number dashboard to work on. A single account can have several dashboards, representing different phone lines for customers.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Id of the dashboard to make this call on

parameters.name: phone_number
parameters.description: Phone number of the contact to create or update.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Phone Number of contact

last_name.description: The new last name of the contact.

value.description: This contact's value for this custom field.

custom_fields.description: Array of custom field ids and values defined for this contact.

is_resolved.description: Determines whether the current conversation with this contact is resolved. Any new texts received by this contact will set this false.
is_resolved.x-ms-summary: Whether the current conversation with this contact has been resolved

get.summary: Retrieves all contacts that match the specified filtering criterion
get.description: Retrieves all contacts that match the specified filtering criterion. Only the dashboard specified will be searched; there is no account level search for a number available.

parameters.name: contact_phone_number
parameters.description: Phone number to filter contacts by.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Contact's phone number to search by

parameters.name: last_message_timestamp_before_utc
parameters.description: Cutoff time for searching contacts by the last message sent or received. No contacts who sent messages after this time will be shown.
parameters.x-ms-summary: 'Last-message-time sent before' search timestamp in UTC time

parameters.name: last_message_timestamp_after_utc
parameters.description: Cutoff time for searching contacts by the last message sent or received. No contacts whose last sent message is before this time will be shown.
parameters.x-ms-summary: 'Last-message-time sent after' search timestamp in UTC time

parameters.name: contact_created_before
parameters.description: Cutoff time for searching contacts by when they were created. No contacts created after this time will be shown.
parameters.x-ms-summary: 'Created before' search timestamp

parameters.name: contact_created_after
parameters.description: Cutoff time for searching contacts by when they were created. No contacts created before this time will be shown.
parameters.x-ms-summary: 'Created after' search timestamp

parameters.name: is_resolved
parameters.description: Whether to search for contacts whose conversations have been resolved.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Whether contact's conversation is resolved

parameters.name: is_blocked
parameters.description: Whether to search for contacts who have been blocked.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Whether contact is blocked

parameters.name: is_archived
parameters.description: Whether to search for contacts who have been archived.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Whether contact is archived

parameters.name: is_suppressed
parameters.description: Whether to search for contacts who have been suppressed.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Whether contact is suppressed

parameters.name: has_opted_out
parameters.description: Whether to search for contacts who have opted out of receiving texts.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Whether contact has opted out

parameters.name: last_message_sent_before
parameters.description: Cutoff time for searching contacts by when the last message was sent to the customer. No contacts who sent messages after this time will be shown. Uses timestamp as local time. To filter by time stamp in UTC time, use last_message_sent_before_utc
parameters.x-ms-summary: 'Last-message-time sent before' search timestamp

parameters.name: last_message_sent_after
parameters.description: Cutoff time for searching contacts by when the last message was sent to the customer. No contacts whose last sent message is before this time will be shown. Uses timestamp as local time. To filter by time stamp in UTC time, use last_message_sent_after_utc
parameters.x-ms-summary: 'Last-message-time sent after' search timestamp

parameters.name: last_message_received_before
parameters.description: Cutoff time for searching contacts by the last message received from the customer. No contacts who received messages after this time will be shown. Uses timestamp as local time. To filter by time stamp in UTC time, use last_message_sent_before_utc
parameters.x-ms-summary: 'Last-message-time received before' search timestamp

parameters.name: last_message_received_after
parameters.description: Cutoff time for searching contacts by the last message received from the customer. No contacts whose last sent message is before this time will be shown. Uses timestamp as local time. To filter by time stamp in UTC time, use last_message_sent_before_utc
parameters.x-ms-summary: 'Last-message-time received after' search timestamp

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of guids referring to tags to filter contacts by.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Contact Tags

parameters.name: groups
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of integer ids referring to groups to filter contacts by.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Contact Groups

parameters.name: custom_field_id_1
parameters.description: Guid referring to custom field to filter contacts by.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Id of custom field to filter by

parameters.name: custom_field_value_1
parameters.description: Value referring to custom field to filter contacts by.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Value of custom field to filter by

parameters.name: custom_field_id_2
parameters.description: Guid referring to second custom field to filter contacts by.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Id of second custom field to filter by

parameters.name: custom_field_value_2
parameters.description: Value referring to second custom field to filter contacts by.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Value of second custom field to filter by

parameters.name: custom_field_id_3
parameters.description: Guid referring to third custom field to filter contacts by.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Id of third custom field to filter by

parameters.name: custom_field_value_3
parameters.description: Value referring to third custom field to filter contacts by.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Value of third custom field to filter by

parameters.name: page
parameters.x-ms-summary: Number page to get
parameters.description: The page of entities to get. When getting values, there is a max size per page, defined by page_size. If page is greater than the last page, an empty array will be returned.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.x-ms-summary: Amount of each entity to get per page
parameters.description: The size of each page to get. When getting values, this is a max size per page, with accessing subsequent pages done by the page parameter.

parameters.name: dashboard_id
parameters.description: The phone number dashboard to work on. A single account can have several dashboards, representing different phone lines for customers.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Id of the dashboard to make this call on

get.summary: Retrieves a group by its id
get.description: Retrieves the group with the specified id.

parameters.name: dashboard_id
parameters.description: The phone number dashboard to work on. A single account can have several dashboards, representing different phone lines for customers.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Id of the dashboard to make this call on

parameters.name: group_id
parameters.description: The numerical id of the group to get.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Id of the group

200.description: The return payload when the request succeeds without any errors.

id.description: The numerical id of the group.

group_member_count.description: The number of members of the group.

is_keyword.description: Wheter this group is a keyword group. Such groups are autogenerated when a user sets up a keyword. Contacts are automatically added when they enroll.

last_message_sent_utc.description: Timestamp of when the last group message was sent for this group.

204.description: The return payload when the request succeeds, but found no content to return.

delete.summary: Deletes the group with the specified id
delete.description: Deletes the group with the specified id. This will succeed even if there are contacts that are members of the group (the contacts will not be deleted).

parameters.name: dashboard_id
parameters.description: The phone number dashboard to work on. A single account can have several dashboards, representing different phone lines for customers.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Id of the dashboard to make this call on

parameters.name: group_id
parameters.description: The numerical id of the group to delete.

get.summary: Retrieves the payment with the specified id
get.description: Retrieves the payment with the specified id.

parameters.name: dashboard_id
parameters.description: The phone number dashboard to work on. A single account can have several dashboards, representing different phone lines for customers.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Id of the dashboard to make this call on

parameters.name: payment_id
parameters.description: The numerical id of the payment to get.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Id of the payment

200.description: The return payload when the request succeeds without any errors.

payment_id.description: The numerical id of the payment.

request_date.description: The timestamp of when this payment's initial message was queued to be sent.

recipient.description: The name of the payment recipient. This may be null if the contact does not have a name associated with their phone number.

description.description: The description of the payment. This is not shown to the contact. It is only used by internal users for context about payments.

customer_phone.description: The phone number of the contact who is being sent this payment.

amount_requested.description: The amount in dollars requested by this payment.

is_past_due.description: Whether this payment is past the request date.

reminder_was_sent.description: Whether a text reminder has already been sent for this payment.

transaction_status.description: The status of the transaction in authvia. This value starts as Unknown.

textrequest_payment_status.description: The status of the transaction in Text Request. This represents that status shown in the payments page on the Text Request app. It starts as Sent.

reference_number.description: The user-defined id defined when payments are created that can be used to quickly find payments. Reference numbers are not unique; many payments can have the same reference.

204.description: The return payload when the request succeeds, but found no content to return.

400.description: The return payload when the request has bad, missing, or invalid data.

post.description: Closes a payment as "paid". Use this endpoint for when the payment is paid through a means other than the payment request portal. This will close the payment and add its payment amount to your statistics. This endpoint is not required for payments paid through the payments-portal sent through Text Request; that will automatically mark a payment as paid.

parameters.description: The phone number dashboard to work on. A single account can have several dashboards, representing different phone lines for customers.

parameters.x-ms-summary: Id of the payment

post.summary: Send a follow-up text reminding the user to pay the specified payment
post.description: Sends a reminder to the contact to pay the specified payment. The content of the message is auto-generated. To avoid spam, only one reminder can be sent per payment

post.description: Cancels the specified payment, texting the user that the payment has been canceled. Payments cannot be edited, so canceling and issuing a new payment is the best way to correct a payment.

put.description: Updates a dashboard. This does not change a dashboard's phone number. If you want a new number with another dashboard's contacts, you will have to create a new dashboard with a POST and add the contacts with a bulk export/import.

get.summary: Retrieves all conversations for this dashboard
get.description: Retrieves all conversations for this dashboard, and includes info on the last message for each conversation.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of guids referring to tags to filter conversations by.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Contact Tags

parameters.name: show_unresolved_only
parameters.description: Whether to only search for contacts whose conversations have been resolved. If this is false, both resolved and unresolved conversations will be shown.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Whether to show only resolved conversations

parameters.name: include_archived
parameters.description: Whether to include conversations with contacts that have been archived.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Whether to include archived conversations

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Search term for filtering conversations by phone number or display name. If the search term is less than a full name or phone number, the search will return all conversations that partially match it.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Term to filter by for phone numbers and contact name

parameters.name: page
parameters.x-ms-summary: Number page to get
parameters.description: The page of entities to get. When getting values, there is a max size per page, defined by page_size. If page is greater than the last page, an empty array will be returned.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.x-ms-summary: Amount of each entity to get per page
parameters.description: The size of each page to get. When getting values, this is a max size per page, with accessing subsequent pages done by the page parameter.

parameters.name: dashboard_id
parameters.description: The phone number dashboard to work on. A single account can have several dashboards, representing different phone lines for customers.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Id of the dashboard to make this call on

200.description: The return payload when the request succeeds without any errors.

page.description: The page of entities gotten. The amount of entities in this page is defined by page_size.

page_size.description: The number of entities gotten in this page.

total_items.description: The number of entities available in the database, regardless of the page size or number. To see the other pages, change the page number in the request.

meta.description: Metadata about the data returned by this request. This data is returned by all bulk GET requests.

message_id.description: Id of the message. This value is unique for each message.

message_direction.description: Singular character, either R or S, denoting whether this message was received from the contact or sent to them, respectively.

response_by_username.description: Username of the Text Request user that last sent a message to this user.

message_timestamp_utc.description: Timestamp of when the message was sent or received by Text Request.

delivery_status.description: Current status of this message. This can be 'sending', 'delivered', 'error', or 'send'.

delivery_error.description: Error that caused this message to not be delivered. If the delivery_status is not 'error', this value will be null.

mms_media.description: List of urls pointing to this message's attachments. All urls will be text-request generated urls.

last_message.description: Last message sent to or from this contact.

items.description: List of conversation entities gotten from Text Request.

204.description: The return payload when the request succeeds, but found no content to return.

post.summary: Create a new dashboard with the given name and phone number
post.description: Creates a new dashboard in the account. Once the dashboard is created, admins will be emailed about the change and can begin assigning users. This endpoint can make a dashboard for any provisioned numbers. You can search for provisioned numbers in a specific area code using GET /dashboards/provisioning. If the phone number is already in use, a Bad Request exception will be thrown.

phone.description: The texting number associated with this dashboard.

200.description: The return payload when the request succeeds without any errors.

id.description: The numerical id of the dashboard.

phone.description: The texting number associated with this dashboard.

400.description: The return payload when the request has bad, missing, or invalid data.
